title: UK weather forecast: Thunder, gale-force winds and more flooding to hit Britain
text:

Thunder showers, gale-force winds and further flooding will batter the UK today as the October washout rolls on.

Heavy downpours are expected across the country today, although the weather should be bright and dry in east and south-east England.

It will be a fairly sunny morning for most in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, however most of the country will see rainfall at different points this afternoon.

Downpours are set to lash Scotland from the start, while the first thundery showers of the day are expected in west Wales.

Lightning will also strike south-west and south-east England this afternoon, the Met Office predicts.

Forecasters are also anticipating gale-force winds in parts of the UK today, with gusts of up to 48mph.

Strong winds will be limited to the north and west of the country.

The Environment Agency has issued two flood warnings for York and 16 alerts for other areas, meaning flooding is possible in north-east, central and east England.

(Image: PA)

Luke Miall, Met Office forecaster, told Mirror Online: "Today will see sunshine and showers across much of UK, we will see some gales in north-west Scotland.

"Wind gusts will probably reach 50mph in north-west Scotland and similar strength winds are possible in the Pennines in northern England.

"Most places will see heavy downpours at some time today.

"We could also see a few rumbles of thunder... and a small chance of hail in some of the heavy showers.

"I think we will see a maximum of 19C in London today but because of the strong winds it will feel cooler than that.

"We're not expecting too many impacts (surface flooding) from further rain today."

BBC forecaster Stav Danaos said: "Lots of showers in the west will work themselves eastwards through the day again some of them could be heavy, like I mentioned thundery.

"The showers will move through quite quickly on a strong and squally wind, gusts of 40-50mph particularly when the showers come along."

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Windy with a mixture of sunny spells and blustery showers, heavy at times. The heaviest and most frequent showers will be over western UK, especially western Scotland, whilst some eastern parts of England and Scotland may stay mostly dry.

Tonight:

Clear spells and blustery showers, western Scotland and the far southwest of England and Wales likely seeing the heaviest showers. Becoming drier in some eastern parts of the UK. Windy.

Wednesday:

Windy with a mixture of sunny spells and showers. Western UK can expect the heaviest and most frequent showers whilst parts of eastern England and eastern Scotland may stay dry.

Outlook for Thursday to Saturday:

Staying unsettled with showers or longer spells of rain for all areas. Only limited amounts of drier and brighter weather. Windy at times, particularly on Friday. Temperatures close to average.
description: The Met Office predicts rumbles of thunder and 50mph wind gusts across the UK today as the October washout continues
